params.name: vocab_size
params.description: Vocabulary size of inputs_ids in ErnieMModel. Also is the vocab size of token embedding matrix.Defines the number of different tokens that can be represented by the inputs_ids passed when callingErnieMModel.

params.name: hidden_size
params.description: Dimensionality of the embedding layer, encoder layers and pooler layer.

params.name: num_hidden_layers
params.description: Number of hidden layers in the Transformer encoder.

params.name: num_attention_heads
params.description: Number of attention heads for each attention layer in the Transformer encoder.

params.name: intermediate_size
params.description: Dimensionality of the feed-forward (ff) layer in the encoder. Input tensors to feed-forward layers arefirstly projected from hidden_size to intermediate_size, and then projected back to hidden_size. Typicallyintermediate_size is larger than hidden_size.

params.name: hidden_act
params.description: The non-linear activation function in the feed-forward layer. gelu, relu and any other torchsupported activation functions are supported.

params.name: hidden_dropout_prob
params.description: The dropout probability for all fully connected layers in the embeddings and encoder.

params.name: attention_probs_dropout_prob
params.description: The dropout probability used in MultiHeadAttention in all encoder layers to drop some attention target.

params.name: max_position_embeddings
params.description: The maximum value of the dimensionality of position encoding, which dictates the maximum supported lengthof an input sequence.

params.name: initializer_range
params.description: The standard deviation of the normal initializer for initializing all weight matrices. The index of paddingtoken in the token vocabulary.

params.name: layer_norm_eps
params.description: The epsilon used by the layer normalization layers.

params.name: classifier_dropout
params.description: The dropout ratio for the classification head.

params.name: act_dropout
params.description: This dropout probability is used in ErnieMEncoderLayer after activation.
